auto_merge.commit_message:
- Move `__Pyx_init_memviewslice()` out of the general declarations to make it a dependency.
- Move refcounting related declarations into a separate section.
- Avoid a circular dependency for the `MemviewSliceCopyTemplate` utility code.
- Use `Naming` substitutions throughout to reduce the Tempita runs.
- Remove the unused `__Pyx_BUF_MAX_NDIMS` macro.
- Fix "_Py_NO_RETURN" macro usage (only used as a hint).
auto_merge.commit_title: Clean up dependencies in memoryview utility code (GH-7210)

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
- Move `__Pyx_init_memviewslice()` out of the general declarations to make it a dependency.
- Move refcounting related declarations into a separate section.
- Avoid a circular dependency for the `MemviewSliceCopyTemplate` utility code.
- Use `Naming` substitutions throughout to reduce the Tempita runs.
- Remove the unused `__Pyx_BUF_MAX_NDIMS` macro.

comment_data.body: Since it is available from CPython 3.3 cannot we remove this `#ifndef`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -374,8 +370,30 @@ __Pyx_init_memviewslice(struct __pyx_memoryview_obj *memview,
     return retval;
 }
 
+
+////////// MemviewRefcount.proto //////////
+//@substitute: naming
+
+static CYTHON_INLINE int __pyx_add_acquisition_count_locked(
+    __pyx_atomic_int_type *acquisition_count, PyThread_type_lock lock);
+static CYTHON_INLINE int __pyx_sub_acquisition_count_locked(
+    __pyx_atomic_int_type *acquisition_count, PyThread_type_lock lock);
+
+#define __pyx_get_slice_count_pointer(memview) (&memview->acquisition_count)
+#define __PYX_INC_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil) __Pyx_INC_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil, __LINE__)
+#define __PYX_XCLEAR_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil) __Pyx_XCLEAR_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil, __LINE__)
+static CYTHON_INLINE void __Pyx_INC_MEMVIEW($memviewslice_cname *, int, int);
+static CYTHON_INLINE void __Pyx_XCLEAR_MEMVIEW($memviewslice_cname *, int, int);
+
+
+////////// MemviewRefcount //////////
+//@substitute: naming
+
+// vsnprintf
+#include <stdio.h>
+
 #ifndef Py_NO_RETURN
-// available since Py3.3
+// available since CPython 3.3

comment_data.body: I wasn't sure if it's in all Python implementations (outside of CPython); so I left it. But yes, worth revisiting.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -374,8 +370,30 @@ __Pyx_init_memviewslice(struct __pyx_memoryview_obj *memview,

 }

+    __pyx_atomic_int_type *acquisition_count, PyThread_type_lock lock);
+static CYTHON_INLINE int __pyx_sub_acquisition_count_locked(
+    __pyx_atomic_int_type *acquisition_count, PyThread_type_lock lock);
+
+#define __pyx_get_slice_count_pointer(memview) (&memview->acquisition_count)
+#define __PYX_INC_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil) __Pyx_INC_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil, __LINE__)
+#define __PYX_XCLEAR_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil) __Pyx_XCLEAR_MEMVIEW(slice, have_gil, __LINE__)
+static CYTHON_INLINE void __Pyx_INC_MEMVIEW($memviewslice_cname *, int, int);
+static CYTHON_INLINE void __Pyx_XCLEAR_MEMVIEW($memviewslice_cname *, int, int);
+
+
+////////// MemviewRefcount //////////
+//@substitute: naming
+
+// vsnprintf
+#include <stdio.h>
+
 #ifndef Py_NO_RETURN
-// available since Py3.3
+// available since CPython 3.3

comment_data.body: I think it might be `_Py_NO_RETURN` with an underscore. I can't find `Py_NO_RETURN` in CPython (but maybe I'm missing something). CPython, PyPy and GraalPy all look to define the underscore version.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -374,8 +370,30 @@ __Pyx_init_memviewslice(struct __pyx_memoryview_obj *memview,
     return retval;
 }

comment_data.body: Thanks for checking. I'll fix the name and keep the fallback, just in case. It's really just a hint, nothing serious that would merit any kind of trouble.

commit.message: Move memoryview slice cnames to Naming.py.

Clean up dependencies in memoryview code.
- Move "__Pyx_init_memviewslice()" out of the general declarations to make it a dependency.
- Move refcounting related declarations into a separate section.
 - Avoid a circular dependency for "MemviewSliceCopyTemplate" utility code.
-- Use "Naming" substitutions throughout to reduce the Tempita runs.

milestone.description: First feature release after the cleanup releases 3.0 and 3.1.

title: Clean up dependencies in memoryview utility code
